name: rescind
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to make a law, agreement, order, or decision no longer have any (legal) power: The policy of charging air travellers for vegetarian meals proved unpopular and has already been rescinded. Synonyms
annul specialized
countermand formal
lift (END)
overturn
repeal
reverse
revoke formal

Add to word list
to make a law, order, or decision no longer have any legal effect: The vote rescinds zoning decisions made earlier in the decade.
Add to word list
Add to word list
LAW to officially end a law, take back a decision, or say that an agreement no longer exists: rescind a law/contract/decision We urge the committee to rescind its decision.
